messages.message: I was thinking of using FAST=true originally, but currently it has that overloaded notion for webapp and for mypy already. Perhaps its worth adding another meaning to FAST=true in that it ignores building proto and thrift files?
I wonder if application of these flags could even be automated by looking at the change date on source files versus input files...

its a good point, but i think we still need to hide it under a flag. on the build machine, there wouldn't be a delta on the source and input files, but we'd still always want to generate the thrift and proto file in "make build"
